elements.label: Edge
elements.desc: All conquest occurs at the Edge. One who dwells there is blind, and cannot be wounded. Another is strong, and grows stronger. [Edge is the principle of battle and of struggle.]

elements.label: Forge
elements.desc: 'Fire', I once read, 'is the winter that warms and the spring that consumes.' [The principle of the Forge transforms and destroys.]

elements.label: Grail
elements.desc: Hunger, lust, the drowning waters. [The principle of the Grail honours both the birth and the feast.]

elements.label: Heart
elements.desc: The Heart Relentless beats to protect the skin of the world we understand. [The Heart is the principle that continues and preserves.]

elements.label: Knock
elements.desc: The principle called Knock permits no seal and no isolation. It thrusts us gleefully out of the safety of ignorance. [Knock opens doors and unseams barriers.]

elements.label: Lantern
elements.desc: 'Life is a pure flame, and we live by an invisible Sun within us.' - Thomas Browne. [Lantern is the principle of the secret place sometimes called the House of the Sun, and of the light above it.]

elements.label: Moon
elements.desc: Secrets are soft; night is softer still; the sea speaks. It is not always wise to listen. [The nocturnal, the forgotten.]

elements.label: Moth
elements.desc: I knew a man who captured moths in a bell-jar. On nights like this, he would release them one by one to die in the candle. [Moth is the wild and perilous principle of chaos and yearning.]

elements.label: Nectar
elements.desc: The green wealth in the world's veins; the pulse of the seasons. [Long ago, some called this principle Blood.]

elements.label: Rose
elements.desc: 'The rose which encompasseth all'. Nine directions to new horizons. [Exploration? Enlightenment? Hope?]

elements.label: Scale
elements.desc: Hard without, hard within, hard to rouse, harder to subdue. [What is left of the crude powers of the deep earth.]

elements.label: Sky
elements.desc: Wind, storm, echo, song; the intricacies of mathematics and the principles of flight. Law's touch is lighter than we sometimes think. [Matters of balance, harmony and necessity.]

elements.label: Winter
elements.desc: ... [Winter is the principle of silence, of endings, and of those things that are not quite dead.]

elements.label: Mystery: Edge
elements.desc: Greater challenges require stronger skills.

elements.label: Mystery: Forge
elements.desc: Greater challenges require stronger skills.

elements.label: Mystery: Grail
elements.desc: Greater challenges require stronger skills.

elements.label: Mystery: Heart
elements.desc: Greater challenges require stronger skills.

elements.label: Mystery: Knock
elements.desc: Greater challenges require stronger skills.

elements.label: Mystery: Lantern
elements.desc: Greater challenges require stronger skills.

elements.label: Mystery: Moon
elements.desc: Greater challenges require stronger skills.

elements.label: Mystery: Moth
elements.desc: Greater challenges require stronger skills.

elements.label: Mystery: Nectar
elements.desc: Greater challenges require stronger skills.

elements.label: Mystery: Rose
elements.desc: Greater challenges require stronger skills.

elements.label: Mystery: Scale
elements.desc: Greater challenges require stronger skills.

elements.label: Mystery: Sky
elements.desc: Greater challenges require stronger skills.

elements.label: Mystery: Winter
elements.desc: Greater challenges require stronger skills.

elements.label: Mastery: Edge
elements.desc: I am well acquainted with this text.

elements.label: Mastery: Forge
elements.desc: I am well acquainted with this text.

elements.label: Mastery: Grail
elements.desc: I am well acquainted with this text.

elements.label: Mastery: Heart
elements.desc: I am well acquainted with this text.

elements.label: Mastery: Knock
elements.desc: I am well acquainted with this text.

elements.label: Mastery: Lantern
elements.desc: I am well acquainted with this text.

elements.label: Mastery: Moon
elements.desc: I am well acquainted with this text.

elements.label: Mastery: Moth
elements.desc: I am well acquainted with this text.

elements.label: Mastery: Nectar
elements.desc: I am well acquainted with this text.

elements.label: Mastery: Rose
elements.desc: I am well acquainted with this text.

elements.label: Mastery: Scale
elements.desc: I am well acquainted with this text.

elements.label: Mastery: Sky
elements.desc: I am well acquainted with this text.

elements.label: Mastery: Winter
elements.desc: I am well acquainted with this text.

elements.label: mastering: Edge
elements.desc: Recipe aspect to trigger skill release etc

elements.label: mastering: Forge
elements.desc: Recipe aspect to trigger skill release etc

elements.label: mastering: Grail
elements.desc: Recipe aspect to trigger skill release etc

elements.label: mastering: Heart
elements.desc: Recipe aspect to trigger skill release etc

elements.label: mastering: Knock
elements.desc: Recipe aspect to trigger skill release etc

elements.label: mastering: Lantern
elements.desc: Recipe aspect to trigger skill release etc

elements.label: mastering: Moon
elements.desc: Recipe aspect to trigger skill release etc

elements.label: mastering: Moth
elements.desc: Recipe aspect to trigger skill release etc

elements.label: mastering: Nectar
elements.desc: Recipe aspect to trigger skill release etc

elements.label: mastering: Rose
elements.desc: Recipe aspect to trigger skill release etc

elements.label: mastering: Scale
elements.desc: Recipe aspect to trigger skill release etc

elements.label: mastering: Sky
elements.desc: Recipe aspect to trigger skill release etc

elements.label: mastering: Winter
elements.desc: Recipe aspect to trigger skill release etc

elements.label: Element of the Soul
elements.desc: The human soul is composed of nine elements, and this is one. Most other things have simpler souls. [Each Soul card can be used once a day, for the kind of things you do with your soul. That usually means 'talking to people' or 'crafting'.]

elements.label: Element of the Soul?
elements.desc: The human soul is composed of nine elements... [Remember what you were, with the help of your journal.]

elements.label: Advancing
elements.desc: (recipe aspect)
elements.comments: Also used as an invisible tick element

elements.label: Agenda: Corrivality
elements.desc: This one believes that conflict is necessary for the world's sustention.

elements.label: Agenda: Peace
elements.desc: This one believes that struggle and war may yet be the cause of the world's immolation.

elements.label: Agenda: Secrecy
elements.desc: This one is aware of the perils of knowledge and the benefits of Calyptra.

elements.label: Agenda: Revelation
elements.desc: This one wishes to share knowledge, despite Calyptra.

elements.label: Agenda: Autarchy
elements.desc: This one thinks it important that humankind - and any Institute that guards it - can survive without the patronage of any Hour.

elements.label: Agenda: Better Gods
elements.desc: This one hopes to build something to substitute for the Hours.

elements.label: Agenda: Stone Consumed
elements.desc: This one would burn or shatter what remains of the gods-from-stone, to fuel their own purposes.

elements.label: Agenda: Stone Remembered
elements.desc: This one would recall or preserve something of the gods-from-stone.

elements.label: Appointing
elements.desc: (recipe aspect)

elements.label: Secretary Enigmatic
elements.desc: The Secretary Enigmatic conceals or reveals the Institute's secrets.

elements.label: Secretary Nunciant
elements.desc: The Secretary Nunciant communicates and negotiates with other organisations.

elements.label: Secretary Persistent
elements.desc: The Secretary Persistent is ultimately responsible for the Institute's continuity.

elements.label: Secretary Salvant
elements.desc: The Secretary Salvant leads the Institute's healing and restoration efforts.

elements.label: Treasurer
elements.desc: The Treasurer is responsible for the Institute's finances.

elements.label: Secretary Vigilant
elements.desc: The Secretary Vigilant ensures the Institute's safety.

elements.label: Arriving
elements.desc: (recipe aspect) - visitor has reached their destination and is no longer embarking

elements.label: Assistance
elements.desc: The Librarian lives alone. But there's no shame in seeking assistance from others. [Assistance can open new rooms or help with your studies. It disappears when used, or at dawn.]

elements.label: Beverage
elements.desc: There are some things it's wiser to drink in the morning... and others it's wiser to drink in the evening.

elements.label: Beverage: Raveline
elements.desc: [Invisible marker aspect for the various Raveline wine objects]

elements.label: Brewable
elements.desc: Ready to be steeped, or warmed, or transformed. [Use this at a fireplace or kitchen range.]

elements.label: Blank
elements.desc: Come friendly words.

elements.label: Cache
elements.desc: Something interesting must be sealed inside! [Use Consider on this.]

elements.label: Bright Rarity
elements.desc: What bright treasure?

elements.label: Night Rarity
elements.desc: What midnight gift?

elements.label: Unregarded Rarity
elements.desc: What overlooked delight?

elements.label: Sovereign Rarity
elements.desc: What sovereign wonder?

elements.label: Occupant
elements.desc: [A Visitor or Soul Element with this aspect can be placed in a Guest Bed, to occupy it for a while.]

elements.label: Making Camp
elements.desc: I've chosen this as my base - for now.

elements.label: Carcass
elements.desc: Something that once moved without my assistance. [Take this to a Necropsy Table to render it into Animal Bones.]

elements.label: Circumstance
elements.desc: Something that is so, but only for now. [Circumstances disappear in the season of Numa.]

elements.label: Curated: the Librarians of Hush House
elements.desc: I placed this where it belonged.

elements.label: Comfort
elements.desc: Hush House has been called 'bleak', but usually only by those who have never been inside.

elements.label: Connie resigning
elements.desc: (recipe aspect - Connie leaves Bureau)

elements.label: Co-operative
elements.desc: No trouble at all - at least not just now.

elements.label: Considerable
elements.desc: I can use Consider to glean more information about this.

elements.label: C: Mettle
elements.desc: triggers ability req in salons(no loc needed)

elements.label: C: Chor
elements.desc: triggers ability req in salons(no loc needed)

elements.label: C: Ereb
elements.desc: triggers ability req in salons(no loc needed)

elements.label: C: Fet
elements.desc: triggers ability req in salons(no loc needed)

elements.label: C: Shapt
elements.desc: triggers ability req in salons(no loc needed)

elements.label: C: Trist
elements.desc: triggers ability req in salons(no loc needed)

elements.label: C: Wist
elements.desc: triggers ability req in salons(no loc needed)

elements.label: Correspondence
elements.desc: I can reply to this from a writing-desk.

elements.label: Price in Pence
elements.desc: The amount payable in the coin of the realm.

elements.label: Tally Price
elements.desc: A price as the invisible world would reckon it; paid in uncommon currency, like the tokens called spintriae.

elements.label: Count
elements.desc: This is the number that you would count, if you counted it.

elements.label: First Course
elements.desc: Generally eaten as a light snack, or before a Main Course.

elements.label: Main Course
elements.desc: The heart and mainstay of a good meal.

elements.label: Side Dish
elements.desc: Generally eaten as a light snack, or alongside a Main Course.

elements.label: Pudding
elements.desc: 'If you don't eat yer meat, you can't have any pudding. How can you have any pudding if you don't eat yer meat?' - Waters

elements.label: Breaking Camp
elements.desc: I'm moving on.

elements.label: Departing
elements.desc: (recipe aspect) - retires assistance (could also prep visitor for hasty leaving, but we currently only use satisfying + decay

elements.label: Delivery
elements.desc: For me?
elements.comments: Doesn't line up very relevantly with delivering aspect

elements.label: Delivering
elements.desc: (recipe aspect) - replaces a mail order purchase or contact request with its outcome, OR a token that requires a deck draw /  grab from offscreen.

elements.label: Difficulty: Oddity
elements.desc: [A relevant Aspect at this level gives you a chance of finding an oddity.]

elements.label: Difficulty: Rarities
elements.desc: [A relevant Aspect at this level gives you a chance of finding a rarity.]

elements.label: Prentice-level Challenges
elements.desc: The simpler techniques require skill alone. [For basic recipes, provide five degrees of the relevant Aspect].

elements.label: Scholar-level Challenges
elements.desc: More advanced techniques require power as well as significant skill. [For more challenging recipes, provide ten degrees of the relevant Aspect. Every Scholar-level recipe also needs an ingredient with a specific Aspect.].

elements.label: Keeper-level Challenges
elements.desc: Available only to the wise, the great, or the most fortunate of idiots. [For the most challenging recipes, provide fifteen degrees of the relevant Aspect. Every Keeper-level recipe also needs a very specific ingredient - the perfect ingredient may even mean you need less Aspect.].

elements.label: Dissatisfying
elements.desc: e.g. convincing a visitor it's not worth their time. We can use it both for marking them for embarkation, and for dissatisfaction comments

elements.label: Dist
elements.desc: Distributing, pouring out, likely candidate for renaming

elements.label: To Serve -
elements.desc: Use a store of glasses or cups to pour this out.

elements.label: Ductile
elements.desc: [Take this to a Workbench to render it into Wire.]

elements.label: Drying
elements.desc: (recipe aspect)

elements.label: Encaustum Terminale
elements.desc: 'History will be kind to me, for I intend to write it.' - Churchill [Use Encaustum inks to make Determinations which can have far-reaching consequences.]

elements.label: Exalted: Beverage
elements.desc: Drinking a Beverage has improved this assistant's abilities for the day.

elements.label: Exalted: Candle
elements.desc: This assistant has a light to bear into the dark, improving their abilities for the day.

elements.label: Collaboration
elements.desc: You and this assistant are collaborating for the day.

elements.label: Exalted: Fabric
elements.desc: Access to something woven has improved this assistant's abilities for the day.

elements.label: Exalted: Flower
elements.desc: A transient inspiration has improved this assistant's abilities for the day.

elements.label: Exalted: Fuel
elements.desc: Access to Fuel has improved this assistant's abilities for the day.

elements.label: Exalted: Memory
elements.desc: Sharing a Memory has improved this assistant's abilities for the day.

elements.label: Exalted: Metal
elements.desc: Access to a useful metal has improved this assistant's abilities for the day.

elements.label: Exalted: Omen
elements.desc: An apposite auspice has improved this assistant's abilities for the day.

elements.label: Exalted: Pigment
elements.desc: Provision of an exotic pigment has improved this assistant's abilities for the day.

elements.label: Exalted: Sustenance
elements.desc: Consuming Sustenance has improved this assistant's abilities for the day.

elements.label: Exalted: Tool
elements.desc: Borrowing a Tool has improved this assistant's abilities for the day.

elements.label: Exalted: Wood
elements.desc: Access to a useful material has improved this assistant's abilities for the day.

elements.label: Fatigued
elements.desc: Wait a little. [Fatigued abilities always recover at dawn, unless you find a faster means of recovery.]

elements.label: fatiguing
elements.desc: (recipe aspect)

elements.label: fatigue an ability
elements.desc: (recipe aspect)

elements.label: Target drinks specifically
elements.desc: (recipe aspect)

elements.label: Use up a wide variety of items
elements.desc: (recipe aspect)

elements.label: fatigue a memory
elements.desc: (recipe aspect)
(recipe aspect)

elements.label: Target food specifically
elements.desc: (recipe aspect)

elements.label: Fear: Chandler
elements.desc: This one knows the dangers in the Chandler's coming.

elements.label: Fear: Ys
elements.desc: This one knows the peril of Ys' seductions.

elements.label: Fear: Carapace
elements.desc: This one knows that the Carapace might consume humanity - or alter it beyond recognition.

elements.label: Fear: Devourers
elements.desc: This one knows the perils of the hidden world: alukites, Mansus-spirits, hungry ghosts...

elements.label: Fear: Nowhere
elements.desc: This one understands the all-consuming horror of the gods-from-Nowhere.

elements.label: Fixed in Place
elements.desc: I cannot remove this without applying sufficient force to damage it... and no Librarian of the House would be so crude.

elements.label: Codex
elements.desc: Pages, cover, spine, knowledge decently tucked away like organs.

elements.label: Reel of Film
elements.desc: And you thought books were flammable. ['Readable' in only the broadest sense. Find a Projector to play this.]

elements.label: Multitudinuous
elements.desc: [There are multiple versions of this book, each individually readable; you'll start finding them once you've exhausted all other possibilities from a particular source.]

elements.label: Instrument
elements.desc: Music waits here.

elements.label: Phonograph Record
elements.desc: A labyrinth of eager grooves awaits the stylus. ['Readable' in only the broadest sense. Find a Phonograph to play this.]

elements.label: Scroll
elements.desc: A book with a very long page.

elements.label: Tablet
elements.desc: A book with very few pages.

elements.label: Beast
elements.desc: When it moves, and it's not the wind, and it's not a person.

elements.label: Egg
elements.desc: 'When an egg is not dead, something may emerge. When an egg is dead, something may be placed within.' - Thirza Blake, seventh Librarian of Hush House

elements.label: Fabric and Fibre
elements.desc: Killasimi, the 'woven language', is written with thread, not ink. There are of course other, more prosaic uses for fibre too. Upholstery can be more adventurous than it sounds.

elements.label: Finished
elements.desc: This is, in one sense at least, complete; concluded; done.

elements.label: Flower
elements.desc: The hair of a plant.

elements.label: Friend
elements.desc: Someone knows you well enough to trust you.

elements.label: Befriend
elements.desc: (recipe aspect)

elements.label: Bread
elements.desc: The grains suffer so, that they may enter into us and be one with us.

elements.label: Candle
elements.desc: They generally burn brighter, but we generally burn longer.

elements.label: Cleaning
elements.desc: (recipe aspect)

elements.label: Delegacizing
elements.desc: Recipe meta aspect for resolving problem content

elements.label: Device
elements.desc: A machine that will only operate once. If it's an infernal device, that means it'll explode, so be careful.

elements.label: Dissipating
elements.desc: (recipe aspect) - removes or sets ready for retirement temporary conditions (like dampness) - xpans at dawn

elements.label: Employable
elements.desc: This is someone you can hire for a day.

elements.label: Fee
elements.desc: This person's price for a day's work.

elements.label: Forgetting
elements.desc: (recipe aspect) - sets memories ready for retirement

elements.label: Very Forgetting
elements.desc: (recipe aspect) - sets all memories ready for retirement, even Persistent ones

elements.label: Fruit
elements.desc: The womb of a plant?

elements.label: Fuel
elements.desc: 'Each hour has its colour. Each flame has its fuel. Don't trust your dreams.' - George Collers, first and last Governor of Brancrug Gaol

elements.label: Gem
elements.desc: Sometimes shiny; always precious.

elements.label: Glass
elements.desc: Lucent and fragile. Even sand may some day be the eye of rock.

elements.label: Grateful
elements.desc: Someone found my assistance useful.

elements.label: Hanging
elements.desc: Deck the halls.

elements.label: History
elements.desc: History is not what happened; it's what is known to have happened. [You have made a decision that will change the world's course. Bring your journal to the Tree in the season of Numa.]

elements.label: Host Echidna Technique
elements.desc: This skill can host the Summon Echidna Technique

elements.label: Incident
elements.desc: A matter of interest to visitors. [An Incident will usually remain relevant for several seasons; visitors will continue to visit in the hiatus before the next Incident.]

elements.label: Cooking Ingredient
elements.desc: This will be part of something greater. [When you have HOUSE OF LIGHT, Cooking Ingredients can be used for cooking and making food in the kitchen.]

elements.label: Inert
elements.desc: A device; but not one that can be activated by casual handling. [This can survive Consider without being used up, although it'll still be used up in crafting.]

elements.label: Ink
elements.desc: If it scrawls, mix it.

elements.label: Inspired
elements.desc: Someone with a higher agenda.

elements.label: Intoxicating
elements.desc: 'Quick, bring me a beaker of wine, so that I may wet my mind and say something clever.' - Aristophanes

elements.label: An Introduction
elements.desc: Even in this remote place, one can meet new friends, or make new enemies.

elements.label: An Invitation
elements.desc: If I take this to the Post Office - then if I have money for a stamp - if the recipient is at home - if they don't have other business - if they aren't even now leaving Brancrug - then this will bring them here.

elements.label: Journal
elements.desc: I began before this book, but it'll end when I do.

elements.label: Key
elements.desc: 'That part of the soul called shapt is left outside the White Door of the Mansus, as a key in the door'. (Or as a sword outside a king's hall, if you listen to the Noble Endeavour.)'

elements.label: Kitchenware
elements.desc: This won't look wildly out of place beside a saucepan.

elements.label: Knife
elements.desc: 'This is the line of division.' - Wolfe

elements.label: Leaf
elements.desc: The hands of a plant.

elements.label: Lesson
elements.desc: One step on Wisdom's staircase. [Use this to gain or improve a Skill.]

elements.label: Liquid
elements.desc: 'What seeks the depths, flees the heights, and cannot be constrained by any chain ever forged?'

elements.label: Lens
elements.desc: Thomas Dewulf, called Baron Silence, built the observatory at Brancrug. He was known to pay well, but his requirements were so exacting that no lensgrinder would work with him twice.

elements.label: Light
elements.desc: So we can see, or so we can celebrate.

elements.label: Lyterion
elements.desc: Knowledge related to the Lyterion can go here.

elements.label: Malady
elements.desc: Something has snared or sickened my soul. [Soul cards can be Malady-tainted when you're exposed to dangerous influences - sometimes when you fail in a task. Maladies cannot be exhausted, but your soul is altered and weakened, and there can be serious consequences if they go untreated.]

elements.label: Cured with Forge
elements.desc: This malady can be cured with bed rest, something bracing to drink, and this much Forge aspect to lift the bosky vapours from the soul.

elements.label: Cured with Grail
elements.desc: This malady can be cured with bed rest, something suitably tempting to drink, and this much Grail aspect to recall the realities of flesh.

elements.label: Cured with Heart
elements.desc: This malady can be cured with bed rest, something restorative to drink, and this much Heart aspect to renew the ailing flesh.

elements.label: Cured with Lantern
elements.desc: This malady can be cured with bed rest, something suitable (perhaps bright and invigorating) to drink, and this much Lantern aspect to rekindle the soul's light.

elements.label: Cured with Moth
elements.desc: This malady can be cured with bed rest, something suitable to drink, and this much Moth aspect to distract the possessing presence.

elements.label: Cured with Nectar
elements.desc: This malady can be cured with bed rest, something suitable (perhaps green and soothing) to drink, and this much Nectar aspect to bring the frantic soul back to earth.

elements.label: Cured with Sky
elements.desc: This malady can be cured with bed rest, something suitable (perhaps effervescent) to drink, and this much Sky aspect to cheer the haunted soul.

elements.label: Cured with Winter
elements.desc: This malady can be cured with bed rest, something (preferably cold) to drink, and this much Winter aspect to soothe the sensitive soul.

elements.label: Mark
elements.desc: A fragile, unstable trace.

elements.label: Manuscript
elements.desc: I wrote this; I won't learn anything new from reading it, but Visitors might.

elements.label: Material
elements.desc: Something with the potential to become something. If I put it in something.

elements.label: Memory
elements.desc: Something remembered might be something understood. [Memories can be used to help with crafting and to upgrade Skills. Memories disappear each dawn - except Persistent ones.]

elements.label: St Rhonwen's Message
elements.desc: A reply or a reminder

elements.label: Memories: the Revolutionary
elements.desc: 'Knowledge is the terror of oppressors.' I have overthrown my share of earthly oppressions; but Calyptra is the tyranny of eternity. When at last we can speak its name and live - only then can we call ourselves free.

elements.label: Memories: the Executioner
elements.desc: 'I was employed by the Suppression Bureau to preserve the daylight world, by destroying those things that walk in the night. For years I was faithful to that duty... but sometimes the things I hunted wept when I slew them. And so at last I set aside my knives, and came here, where I can do no more harm. Perhaps I can even make amends.'

elements.label: Memories: the Archaeologist
elements.desc: 'I opened a tomb, and found - too late - that it was a prison. The plague that I released is now my shadow - or perhaps I am its reflection. It is too late to set matters right, but it is never too late to protect the future from the past. In Hush House I can do no harm. Perhaps I can even make amends.'

elements.label: Memories: the Cartographer
elements.desc: 'There is no map of the House of the Sun, where the invisible gods walk. How could there be, when every year it changes, and yet every year it remains the same? Tricky, certainly. Impossible? Let's see.'

elements.label: Memories: the Prodigal
elements.desc: 'My parents were Long - which is to say immortal - and Long are not permitted to make children. Their punishment is this: now that they know I live, they cannot rest until they devour me. Here in Hush House, I will be safe. It is even possible that I might learn to shape a weapon to defend myself.'

elements.label: Memories: the Twice-Born
elements.desc: 'I remember that I once walked the House of the Sun as a bodiless immortal; but there was a matter that could only be resolved if I returned to flesh. Now, if I go back to the House of the Sun, I will be hunted and punished; if I stay in flesh, I will be hunted and devoured. I need a third choice. To remain at Hush House, as Librarian, would be one such choice. But there might be something more.'

elements.label: Memories: the Magnate
elements.desc: 'I've lived too long, but I'm not ready to die. I've tasted everything, and it wasn't enough. Give me silence; give me peace; give me the peace of snow.'

elements.label: Memories: the Symurgist
elements.desc: 'I eavesdropped on the songs of the Aviform Hours. I'd heard the warnings; I'd lose my mind, my soul, my skin. All those things are true, but no-one ever warns you what happens if you get away with it... which is to say, after that, there just doesn't seem to be anything else worth hearing'

elements.label: Memories: the Artist
elements.desc: 'Dada was a start. The Surrealist Manifesto? A step along the road, but only a step. The road goes nowhere, unless it goes into the Wood; and that's a road we can only walk in the dark. Wait, no, not 'in the dark'. 'In blood.' 'Hip-deep in blood.' Oh shut up. Give it to me, I'll write it - '

elements.label: Metal
elements.desc: This is what happens when stone gets serious.

elements.label: Milk
elements.comments: (Not visible - an aspect named milk that goes on the (probably cow's) milk element and possibly other milk elements if there are some)

elements.label: Numa Other Visitors Arrive
elements.desc: (recipe aspect) - eg Spencer
This is something or someone from Numa - the time when 'seems' and 'is' cross swords with 'history' and 'eternity'.

elements.label: Numen
elements.desc: Write a truth in a book that no-one reads. Then drop dead. No-one knows what you wrote. Unless the truth is numen. [Numina are truths so powerful that they, tentatively, believe themselves. You can use a Numen to write a new History at a suitable Desk... if you can assemble 25 of a matching Aspect.]

elements.label: My Bed
elements.desc: My resting place, although I hope not my final resting place. [Use a fresh Soul card to make the bed and move your belongings out of here, if you want to choose a different bed to rest in.]

elements.label: Remove Offering
elements.desc: (recipe aspect)

elements.label: Omen
elements.desc: Those who know, see; those who see, know.

elements.label: Open Air
elements.desc: The birds and the seasons can both freely visit this place.

elements.label: Out of Bounds
elements.desc: This place lies beyond the bounds of the House.

elements.label: Opportunity
elements.desc: A chance to exceed expectations.

elements.label: Realise Opportunity
elements.desc: Recipe aspect: xtriggers a bonus opportunity into its corresponding memory so it persists for the resolution recipe later.

elements.label: Payment
elements.desc: Currently, this just removes the entire coin. With some extra behaviour, it should give change.

elements.label: Pence
elements.desc: The eccentric currency of a fallen empire. One penny is four farthings, twelve pence are one shilling, and so on.

elements.label: Dawn Period
elements.desc: 599 AD is the traditional date of the first foundation here, sometimes called the Abbey of the Black Dove, sometimes the Abbey of the White Crow... but the Sisterhood of the Triple Knot first built their temples here much earlier than that.

elements.label: Solar Gothic Period
elements.desc: From the 11th to the early 16th Century, the sisters and brothers of St Brandan's dwelt on the Isle. It was a holy place, a wealthy place, and a centre of learning - though a surprisingly obscure one. Then in 1534, the Bronze King Henry dissolved the foundation, exiled the brethren, and gave the Isle to the family Dewulf.

elements.label: Baronial Period
elements.desc: In the 16th Century, the Dewulf family became the Barons Brancrug, governing the Isle as their personal estate - until 1759, when their line ended in madness and death.

elements.label: Curia Period
elements.desc: In the 18th century, a secretive cabal of scholars established the 'Curia of the Isle' to manage Hush House, making it a haven of knowledge until 1896 when a disgraced Librarian brought the House to penury.

elements.label: Nocturnal Period
elements.desc: By the beginning of the 20th century, an unwise Librarian's enthusiasms had brought Hush House to penury. Nocturnal Branch - later the Suppression Bureau - stepped in to offer an arrangement. Hush House received funding, but submitted to yearly inspections, and also surrendered a portion of the Isle for the Branch's prison.

elements.label: Persistent
elements.desc: Persistent Memories survive the dawn, but when the season called Numa passes, they will depart with it. Numa comes to Brancrug in one season out of every nine - but exactly when is never certain, and years may pass without any sign of Numa's mists.

elements.label: Pigment
elements.desc: Call it a colour, call it a stain, call it a jewel-in-waiting.

elements.label: Ready to Post
elements.desc: This message will find its destination... once properly sanctioned by the powers of the post-box. [Take it to the Post Office, with cash for a stamp or a postal order.]

elements.label: In the Post
elements.desc: This is used to evoke comments when sending something, since 'delivering' happens offstage.
Agdistis prefers <sprite name=heart> food and drink. [HOUSE OF LIGHT]
Al-Adim prefers <sprite name=scale> food, and won't touch Intoxicating drink. [HOUSE OF LIGHT]
Arthur prefers <sprite name=lantern> food and drink. [HOUSE OF LIGHT]
Arun prefers <sprite name=moon> food and drink. [HOUSE OF LIGHT]
Azita prefers <sprite name=edge> food and drink. [HOUSE OF LIGHT]
Chaima prefers <sprite name=edge> food and drink. [HOUSE OF LIGHT]
Connie prefers <sprite name=sky> food and drink. [HOUSE OF LIGHT]
Coquille prefers <sprite name=grail> food and drink. [HOUSE OF LIGHT]
Corso prefers <sprite name=grail> food and drink. [HOUSE OF LIGHT]
Dagmar prefers <sprite name=knock> food and drink. [HOUSE OF LIGHT]
Douglas prefers <sprite name=lantern> food and drink. [HOUSE OF LIGHT]
Ehsan prefers <sprite name=moon> food, but <sprite name=sky> drink. [HOUSE OF LIGHT]
Fraser prefers <sprite name=scale> food and drink. [HOUSE OF LIGHT]
Hokobald will only consume <sprite name=forge> food and drink. [HOUSE OF LIGHT]
Morgen prefers <sprite name=sky> food and drink... at least in polite company. [HOUSE OF LIGHT]
Olympe prefers <sprite name=forge> food and drink. [HOUSE OF LIGHT]
Serena prefers <sprite name=forge> food and drink. [HOUSE OF LIGHT]
Stanislav prefers <sprite name=heart> food and drink. [HOUSE OF LIGHT]
Yvette will eat or drink anything. She doesn't like to make a fuss. [HOUSE OF LIGHT]
Zachary prefers <sprite name=winter> food and drink. [HOUSE OF LIGHT]

elements.label: Provisioning
elements.desc: To provoke offstage effects from e.g. order forms

elements.label: QF
elements.desc: Xtrigger-rehydrate suitabiliser

elements.label: Rank
elements.desc: (HIDDEN ASPECT used for level-ranking, e.g. in hand spheres)

elements.label: Raw
elements.desc: This might be edible, but you wouldn't serve it on a plate to a guest.

elements.label: Readable
elements.desc: There are worse things to put in your eyes than this.

elements.label: Recovering
elements.desc: (recipe aspect)

elements.label: recover an ability
elements.desc: (recipe aspect)

elements.label: Recruiting
elements.desc: (recipe aspect) Someone is hired / recruited / becomes assistance

elements.label: Remains
elements.desc: This is how you know who was mortal.

elements.label: Replying
elements.desc: Turn correspondence into a response.

elements.label: Requesting
elements.desc: (recipe aspect) Spawns requests from contact addresses

elements.label: Reluctant
elements.desc: Someone who will provide help... but only essential help.
elements.comments: use to lock out Assistance from usual behaviour. In particular, this locks out the intro fisherman from Second Beach (though he doesn't have the Powers anyway) and from a shift-click sending him to Sweet Bones when the village is still shrouded (though we could do with a proper solution / seed for that!)

elements.label: Restorative
elements.desc: For rest and recovery. [Something that will help you recover from Maladies if you use it in bed with sufficient suitable Power aspects - especially, but not exclusively, if it has useful Power aspects itself.]

elements.label: Retiring Liselotte
elements.desc: (recipe aspect - retires Liselotte permanently)

elements.label: Retiring Wisp
elements.desc: (recipe aspect - retires Wisp permanently)

elements.label: Retiring Arthur
elements.desc: (recipe aspect - retires  permanently)

elements.label: Retiring Azita
elements.desc: (recipe aspect - retires  permanently)

elements.label: Retiring Chaima
elements.desc: (recipe aspect - retires  permanently)

elements.label: Retiring Spencer
elements.desc: (recipe aspect - retires Spencer permanently)

elements.label: Retiring Yvette
elements.desc: (recipe aspect - retires Yvette permanently)

elements.label: Retiring Zachary
elements.desc: (recipe aspect - retires Zachary permanently)

elements.label: Root
elements.desc: The feet of a plant.

elements.label: In a Day
elements.desc: [The visitor is busy resolving matters. Come back tomorrow.]

elements.label: Seed
elements.desc: A seed may grow worse in one garden than another, and better in one season than another.

elements.label: Satisfying
elements.desc: e.g. helping out a visitor. We can use it both for marking them for embarkation, and for satisfaction comments

elements.label: Satisfying Echidna
elements.desc: To make sure we don't accidentally also satisfy a visitor we're retiring

elements.label: Season
elements.desc: Time and again.

elements.label: Pausing Season
elements.desc: Freeze-dry a season while we go Numa

elements.label: Unpausing Season
elements.desc: Restore a season

elements.label: Sceptical
elements.desc: Trust can be bought, or earned.

elements.label: Scrutiny
elements.desc: Something's being examined or revealed.

elements.label: Skill
elements.desc: Anything can be learnt; everything can be forgotten.

elements.label: Skill
elements.desc: Anything can be learnt; everything can be forgotten.

elements.label: Language
elements.desc: A skill that can be used to read particular books, among other much less important things.

elements.label: Chandlery
elements.desc: A skill that can be used, with suitable ingredients, to make candles. [The most likely ingredients are beeswax and herbs; but to confound villagers and visitors, leave a meaningful pause before the word 'suitable.']

elements.label: Sleeping Hours
elements.desc: The righteous should be tucked up in bed; the unrighteous are probably about their unrighteous work.

elements.label: Soaked
elements.desc: In peril of dissolution! Intervene quickly, but not hastily.

elements.label: Soiled
elements.desc: Something that needs cleaning.

elements.label: Sound
elements.desc: Before silence, and after.

elements.label: Spicing
elements.desc: Tool, or knowledge, that might be used to add more exotic savours.

elements.label: Cracked
elements.desc: - cracked -

elements.label: Torn
elements.desc: - torn -

elements.label: Stone
elements.desc: 'Ye who seek patience, here is your tutor.'

elements.label: Study
elements.desc: Something, usually a book, has been delved in detail.

elements.comments: Compromise to avoid spoiling surprise candidate without further aspect bloat. This aspect is not visible on Connie-resigned either, but slot glow is an acceptable substitute
Compromise to avoid spoiling surprise candidate without further aspect bloat. This aspect is not visible on Echidna either, but slot glow is an acceptable substitute
Compromise to avoid spoiling surprise candidate without further aspect bloat. This aspect is not visible on Elie either, but slot glow is an acceptable substitute

elements.label: Sustenance
elements.desc: 'The bad live that they may eat and drink; the good eat and drink that they may live.' - Socrates

elements.label: Sympathy: Chandler
elements.desc: This one recognises the golden promise that the Chandler brings.

elements.label: Sympathy: Ys
elements.desc: This one understands the fragile benefits of an alliance with Ys.

elements.label: Sympathy: Carapace
elements.desc: This one understands the possibilities of the Carapace Cross: alliance, awakening.

elements.label: Sympathy: Reckoners
elements.desc: This one understands the benefits of working with the merchants of years.

elements.label: Tally
elements.desc: The consensus currency of the invisible world. Wildly unofficial, eternally consistent.

elements.label: Thing
elements.desc: 'The gentleman makes things his servants. The petty man is servant to things.' - Master Xun

elements.label: Tool
elements.desc: One reason the apes beat the beetles.

elements.label: Visitor
elements.desc: The primary route by which books enter and leave the library. The arrival of a visitor may be cause for a variety of emotions.

elements.label: Visitor: Villager
elements.desc: Someone from Brancrug has accepted an invitation to the House. [You can only invite one villager at a time to the House.]

elements.label: Visitor: Embarking
elements.desc: This visitor is eager to be on their way, and won't usually tarry for conversation.

elements.label: Uncatalogued
elements.desc: 'There's nothing as safe as ignorance  or as dangerous.' - Nero Wolfe

elements.label: Undiscovered
elements.desc: [Once you've discovered this recipe, its requirements will appear here.]

elements.label: Unsociable
elements.desc: [Visitors marked as Unsociable are wary of other Visitors. They won't attend the usual kind of Salon.]

elements.label: Unlocking
elements.desc: (recipe aspect)

elements.label: Unwrapping
elements.desc: Used when opening a delivery to provoke spawns

elements.label: Upgrading
elements.desc: (recipe aspect)

elements.label: Upgrading: Down
elements.desc: (recipe aspect)

elements.label: Upgrading: Out
elements.desc: (recipe aspect)

elements.label: Wrapping
elements.desc: Turns an order form back into a delivery

elements.label: Consecrated
elements.desc: [This place has been consecrated in a way that means it provides Aspect natively.]

elements.label: UNRELEAS'D
elements.desc: Something is needed here that none of us have. [This marks material that will only be available or completed later; not in this early version.]

elements.label: Wall Art
elements.desc: You could describe the whole house as a book, although it would be troublesome to index.

elements.label: wcma
elements.desc: NO NEED TO LOCALISE THIS Marker aspect for writing case so it can go in village slots without confusing non-HOL players. Cleaner to use 'blank' but then we get branch creep.

elements.label: Weather
elements.desc: Each kind of weather brings its own influence. I can make use of these as a Memory.

elements.label: Wood
elements.desc: The pillars of the sky, to some; to others, paper in waiting.

elements.label: Made of Wood
elements.desc: [Take this to a Workbench to render it into Wooden Scraps.]

elements.label: Woven
elements.desc: [Take this to a Workbench to render it into Rags.]

elements.label: Writing
elements.desc: (recipe aspect)

elements.label: Topic: Birdsong
elements.desc: A text on music, riddles or miscellanea.

elements.label: Topic: The Bosk
elements.desc: A text on the matters of the primaeval wood.

elements.label: Topic: Horomachistry
elements.desc: A text on the laws (and disagreements) of the Hours (and their emanations).

elements.label: Topic: Hushery
elements.desc: A text on, among other things, silence.

elements.label: Topic: Illumination
elements.desc: A text on purification of the self and its surroundings.

elements.label: Topic: Ithastry
elements.desc: A text on alchemy, metallurgy, pyrotechnics.

elements.label: Topic: Nyctodromy
elements.desc: A text on the ways and byways of the transmundane.

elements.label: Topic: Preservation
elements.desc: A text on healing and restoration.

elements.label: Topic: Skolekosophy
elements.desc: A text on matters that there shouldn't really be texts on.

elements.label: Birdsong
elements.desc: Music, riddles, miscellanea. 'Less a wisdom, more a body of gossip hallowed by accretion,' a sniffy scholar once remarked.

elements.label: The Bosk
elements.desc: The Wisdom of the primaeval wood; rarely written, often felt.

elements.label: Horomachistry
elements.desc: This Wisdom is concerned with the laws (and disagreements) of the Hours (and their emanations).

elements.label: Hushery
elements.desc: The Great Art of Hushery understands the beauty of silence, and of its sundering.

elements.label: Illumination
elements.desc: Illuminates purify the self and its surroundings. Eventually, they often cease to see any difference between the two.

elements.label: Ithastry
elements.desc: Alchemy, metallurgy, pyrotechnics: Ithastry is sometimes called the Art that Alters.

elements.label: Nyctodromy
elements.desc: 'Travelling at night is neither faster nor safer. That's why we do it.' Knowledge of the ways and byways of the transmundane.

elements.label: Preservation
elements.desc: Healing and restoration. An unglamorous Wisdom, at least to those who never wonder how the world still exists.

elements.label: Skolekosophy
elements.desc: The study of things that should not be studied. Some call this a Wisdom.

elements.label: Committed
elements.desc: You've determined where this skill should belong, in the wide kingdoms of understanding. [This skill is now committed to the Wisdom marked on the card.]

elements.Label: Understands Aramaic
elements.desc: (As do I).

elements.Label: Understands Greek
elements.desc: (As do I).

elements.Label: Understands Latin
elements.desc: (As do I).

elements.Label: Understands Phrygian
elements.desc: (As do I).

elements.Label: Understands Sanskrit
elements.desc: (As do I).

elements.Label: Understands Vak
elements.desc: Understands this bold language.

elements.Label: Understands Kernewek Henavek
elements.desc: Understands this forgotten language well enough to read or teach it.

elements.Label: Understands Deep Mandaic
elements.desc: Understands this resonant language well enough to read or teach it.

elements.Label: Understands Killasimi
elements.desc: Understands this woven language well enough to read or teach it.

elements.Label: Understands Fucine
elements.desc: Understands this dry language well enough to read or teach it.

elements.Label: Understands Sabazine
elements.desc: Understands this enigmatic language well enough to read or teach it.

elements.Label: Understands Cracktrack
elements.desc: Understands this primal language well enough to read or teach it.

elements.Label: Understands Hyksos
elements.desc: Understands this sly language well enough to read or teach it.

elements.Label: Understands Ericapaean
elements.desc: Understands this elegant language well enough to read or teach it.

elements.Label: Understands Ramsund
elements.desc: Understands this lively language well enough to read or teach it.

elements.Label: Written in Latin
elements.desc: A dead language: dead as diamonds. [The Librarian reads Latin, but don't assume others can.]

elements.Label: Written in Greek
elements.desc: A tongue for philosophers, theologians and heroes. [The Librarian reads Greek, but don't assume others can.]

elements.Label: Written in Sanskrit
elements.desc: The holy tongue of the Subcontinent. The door to four thousand years of poetry, ceremony and mystery now opens before you, if you can struggle through the lotus convolutions of its vocabulary. [The Librarian reads Sanskrit, but don't assume others can.]

elements.Label: Written in Phrygian
elements.desc: The Phrygians worshipped the Great Mother, who we call the Grail. Theirs was the land in which the Sisterhood of the Knot was born, and this is the tongue in which the Thunderskin pleaded, at his ascension. [The Librarian can read Phrygian, but few others can.]

elements.Label: Written in Aramaic
elements.desc: The language of Aram, and all her many children these three thousand years and more. [The Librarian reads Aramaic, but don't assume others can.]

elements.Label: Written in Vak
elements.desc: A bold language.

elements.Label: Written in Kernewek Henavek
elements.desc: A forgotten language.

elements.Label: Written in Deep Mandaic
elements.desc: A resonant language.

elements.Label: Written in Killasimi
elements.desc: A woven language.

elements.Label: Written in Fucine
elements.desc: A dry language.

elements.Label: Written in Sabazine
elements.desc: An enigmatic language.

elements.Label: Written in Cracktrack
elements.desc: A primal language.

elements.Label: Written in Hyksos
elements.desc: A sly language.

elements.Label: Written in Ericapaean
elements.desc: An elegant language.

elements.Label: Written in Ramsund
elements.desc: A lively language.

elements.label: Moon [Fatigued]
elements.desc: [When this card recovers, it will have this much Moon again.]

elements.label: Moth [Fatigued]
elements.desc: [When this card recovers, it will have this much Moth again. Yes it will. No it won't. Yes it will. Yes it probably will.]

elements.label: Nectar [Fatigued]
elements.desc: [When this card recovers, it will have this much Nectar again.]
